cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to drift north-northwest, then northwest, reaching the SC/NC coast Sunday and recurving northeastward along/off the Mid-Atlantic coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / North Carolina border coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coasts of South Carolina, North Carolina, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic and New England in the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday–Tuesday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (<1 ft) possible along Delaware Bay and tidal rivers if onshore flow develops; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands could bring 1–2 inches to the Wilmington area early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches beginning late weekend.
